Kim Yong Nam Meets First Vice-President of Council of State of Cuba
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese President and Malaysian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets First Vice-President of Council of State of Cuba 
   Havana, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Raul Castro, first vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba, on Sept. 18.
 At the meeting Kim Yong Nam conveyed to him Kim Jong Il's words of consolation and best wishes for an early recovery of Fidel Castro Ruz, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba.    
 Raul said that Cuba and the DPRK are steadily advancing irrespective of any change in the international situation, stating the two countries would maintain the same stand in their foreign policies and major international issues.

articles.title: Paek Nam Sun Meets New Chinese Ambassador
FTA Negotiations Flailed
articles.content:
Paek Nam Sun Meets New Chinese Ambassador 
   Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun met and conversed with new Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming who paid a courtesy call on him Wednesday.
 On hand were officials concerned of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the minister councilor of the Chinese embassy here.

Aid Materials from China
Rodong Sinmun on Three-Point Patriotic Movement
articles.content:
Aid Materials from China
   Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The government of China provided the DPRK with aid materials including food and diesel fuel in connection with flood damage.

articles.title: Creativity, Attribute of Human Being
Folk Games Encouraged in DPRK
Greetings to Prime Minister of Belize
Preparatory Committee for Commemorating Day of Sun and Feb. 16 Inaugurated
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Belize
   Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Said Musa, Prime Minister of Belize, on the occasion of the 25th independence day of his country. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would more favorably develop, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country and the wellbeing of its people.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee for Commemorating Day of Sun and Feb. 16 Inaugurated
   Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, and February 16, the birthday of Kim Jong Il, in 2007 was inaugurated by the Association for Friendship with the Korean People headquartered in Spain on Sept. 11.
 Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee and the representative of the Norwegian branch of the association who is its international director its first secretary and the representative of the U.S. branch of the association who is its international information secretary its second secretary.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold an Internet seminar on the Songun leadership exploits of the peerlessly great persons, a photo exhibition and film show, issue a special information bulletin and arrange the visit of a delegation to the old home of Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae and the old home of Kim Jong Il in the secret camp of Mt. Paektu on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and February 16 in 2007.
